FuncDef:
The port-queue queue-limit command configures a buffer time for a queue.
The undo port-queue queue-limit command restores the default configuration.
By default, the buffer time of a queue is 50 ms.
CLIs: port-queue { be | af1 | af2 | af3 | af4 | ef | cs6 | cs7 } queue-limit max-buffer-time <time-value>
undo port-queue { be | af1 | af2 | af3 | af4 | ef | cs6 | cs7 } queue-limit

Specifies the buffer time of a queue.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 150, in milliseconds. The default value is 50.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a large volume of traffic keeps being transmitted, traffic congestion occurs and leads to a long delay. You can configure a buffer time for a queue to resolve this problem. Setting a short buffer time speeds up packet forwarding and minimizes delays.
The buffer time of a queue is defined based on 64-byte PPP packets.
Precautions
A buffer time can be configured only on Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP)-capable serial interfaces.
If you run the port-queue queue-limit command repeatedly, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
